figgy.title: I would like OCR to be automatically triggered and embedded in PDFs and/or TIFFS selected for download by patrons.

comments.body: I just tried this tool (https://github.com/jbarlow83/OCRmyPDF) out on a PDF from Figgy and it works pretty well.  It seems reasonably performant (~75 text-heavy pages per minute) and uses tesseract under the hood, plus it looks like it handles PDF image conversion for us.  Worth looking into as well?

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/31163223/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/31163223)

Coverage remained the same at 79.82% when pulling **00b13b7696d9ca698250aca6eb30a4600a54b2f1 on voyager-075** into **7240eee9373ce5e34280abca50eacc61e99ea761 on master**.

marc_liberation.title: [Bibdata] Traject::Indexer::ConfigLoadError: Error loading configuration file /opt/marc_liberation/releases/20200417185535/marc_to_solr/lib/traject_config.rb:29 Faraday::SSLError:SSL_connect returned=1 errno=0 state=error: certificate verify failed (certificate has expired)

orangelight.title: Update Requests for Pickup vs Pick-up
Create a capistrano command to turn off mail catcher & turn it back on on staging
Holds are only valid for 7 days in emails, but voyager allows 60 days

comments.body: Looks like I have some Voyager work remaining! Can you tell me what item ID was used?

https://catalog.princeton.edu/requests/11807092?mfhd=11467956&source=pulsearch
![Screen Shot 2020-06-01 at 10.12.16 AM.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5c925e2d9d1bd30b8d310436/f75955ff-0899-414e-b835-223e4109a18e)
Ok, it looks like it's taking the expiration from https://github.com/pulibrary/requests/blob/aa193410e6416f5e42ec8ebab035e2fa8a0b6235/app/models/concerns/requests/voyager.rb#L79
`<last-interest-date>` should be 7 days from the date of the request for holds.
This expiration date (the 60-day expiration) is what is sent to patrons when the item is available.
To clarify: it is nothing wrong with Voyager's configuration. Changing the last-interest-date to 7 days from now instead of 60 days will fix it.

requests.title: Make the mobile interactions work well

Recap EDD emails with HTML

comments.body:
We currently do not have a template for this. 

@kevinreiss What info do we want in the EDD email?

[Citation Submitted for Pickup, Title, Author, Enumeration/Pagination Requested, Published Date of Item]

[Service Statement - will request this be updated]

For now we can use the brief message currently defined in the template: https://github.com/pulibrary/requests/blob/master/config/locales/requests.en.yml#L121

comments.body: This item is not available to create a hold via voyager: https://catalog-staging.princeton.edu/requests/7617477

Both of the above issues had something a bit off in their holding information in voyager.  I've added better handling of errors in a PR to help with this, but these will not work until voyager is modified.  If someone requests then an email will got to `recapproblems@princeton.edu`

https://catalog-staging.princeton.edu/requests/7617477

This one is for an ebook on an iPad.

https://catalog-staging.princeton.edu/requests/11395328?mfhd=11089235&source=pulsearch
Unsure of what the issue could be here. I'm noting that there are current issues attached to the holding. I don't know if that could have any impact.
@mzelesky  This may be one of hte "non-criculating item types" in a circulating location?
